name: Hotel Nadia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just loved this hotel! The pictures on their website were really cute and nice, and everything was just as we tought it would be. Staff was extra friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and we even got honeymoon flowers to make the room even nicer. Breakfast was a bit poor, but when you think of it, what else do you need... And we even got free drinks from the cooler on arrival and when departed. We would definetely go back there if we would ever visit Amsterdam again!
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Nadia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in Amsterdam many times before, at a wide variety of hotels, but this was our first stay at the Nadia .....and it won't be our last! From the very onset of our stay, the hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly and really couldn't do more for us.
reviews.title: What a little gem of a hotel!

likes.liked: — Friendliness of staff and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early so our room wasn't ready but the Nadia is more than happy to look after your belongings until your room is available. Be advised, like many hotels in Amsterdam, the Nadia has very steep stairs and no lift, but once again the hotel staff insist on carrying your cases up and down any stairs for you, making life much easier. Remember to leave your cases at the bottom of the stairs when you first arrive (reception is on the first floor) and they will collect them for you.
reviews.title: Perfect place!
Good value central hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated. It is directly across the street from Westekerk (near Anne Frank's house) and trams stop there regularly throughout the day (although Amsterdam is best experienced by foot - there are some great finds down the little side streets) It is a few minutes walk to some of the best shopping areas in the city.

Our modest room was very clean, comfortable and had everything we would need for our three night stay. Breakfast (breads cheese, cakes, croissants, yoghurt, juice and tea or coffee) takes place in a lovely balcony breakfast room where again the staff are very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: cosy spot
Great central location, friendly hosts
reviews.text: If you enjoy clean rooms, friendly staff, and courteous service you'll love the Nadia Hotel. Yes, my room was small(It was a single), and the stairs are steep, but that's part of the adventure. Osam and his staff where friendly and helpful... even offering a bottle of water or a soda at no charge if it looked like you needed it! It's centrally located near the Anne Frank House and right on a Tram line. The breakfast room is a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the traffic and bicyclists. I recommend it highly.

reviews.title: central location, enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: great place to stay in amsterdam. central location, right across from the anne frank house and very near to Prinsengracht which is a beautiful street along one of the canals. the stairs are quite daunting when you first walk in though! great breakfast room. room with a balcony is probably better..

reviews.title: great location, lovely staff
reviews.text: Excellent location (in the lovely Jordaan district) and very friendly and obliging staff. The room was v. small but fine for my needs and had been recently refurbished. Breakfast was good, although the breakfast room was quite cramped. As with many Amsterdam Hotels - there is a steep staircase and lots of steps! But I would certainly recommend the Hotel Nadia

reviews.title: Great for small people!
reviews.text: Great location... by the canals, shopping and restaurants. Perfect for a small budget. A very long and narrow flight of stairs to get to the front desk. My room was VERY small, but I was alone and I am a small person, so it was okay for me. They had a TV and a small bed. The breakfast is good and in a lovely dining room overlooking a pretty canal. The owners were wonderful... they knew I was alone, gave me great advice and greeted me excitedly when I arrived back to the hotel at night! They were very gracious.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay
reviews.text: We stayed for one night (July 3-4) at Nadia Hotel. We visited Amsterdam on July 3 and then left on July 4 to the Duinreserve (a lovely national park situated between Amsterdam and Alkmaar).

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.text: Two nights,excellent service,friendly,nice room,good location,welcome drinks and so on. We can recommend this hotel to everybody. Value for money!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peter with family
reviews.title: Great Hotel!! Friendly attentive and clean

reviews.text: This was the greatest hotel... the rooms were very small but well set up so that you had the feeling that they were larger. The rooms themselves were nicely decorated... we had a room with a balcony which is a must in Amsterdam! The staff could not have been friendlier and they were attentive to our every need... There was construction outside and they offered to switch us to another room (it was not really that much of a bother so we stayed) Overall I could not have been happier and I will stay here every time I come to Amsterdam.. Hotel Nadia I love you! I will be back soon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel to stay in, from Emer in Dublin!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple

The location of the hotel is very central only 3 mins walk to the Dam Square where there you will find bars and restaurants and shops, The staff are very friendly and kind and will help you with anything you need, the rooms are clean and tidy and have everything you need in your room, I have stayed there twice this year and I can say that I will be definitely back again!! I loved the Nadia Hotel!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time we arrived at nadia hotel to the time we left the hotel we had the most relaxing time nothing was any trouble. We asked for extra pillows they were there, we asked advise they were very forthcoming.Staff are very helpful even carried our bags up the very steep stairs.Rooms are kept very clean and towels are changed daily.
reviews.title: querky hotel - love the stairs

likes.liked: — very central location and having a balcony
likes.disliked: — a wee bit noisy on Raadhuisstrat, although not too bad to keep us awake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed at the Nadia whilst travelling around europe on our honeymoon.We arrived at the hotel to be greeted with the mount everest staircase.We were pleased when a staff member said they would take care of our bags.We checked in and were toldwe had been given a room upgrade.It was a larger room facing the canal.We had been in the room 10 minutes when there was a knock on the door.They had sent a bunch of flowers to room for us to celebrate our marriage.We spent 4 nights there and the stay was 1st class from beginning to end.We were given helpful information an were to go and how to get there.The owner of the hotel helped us book our transfer to the airport and even rang when we were checking out to thank us for staying with them and to wish us well on the rest of our travels.I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying there.It is in a great location and is value for money.I would not hesitate to stay there in the future
reviews.title: What A Great Stay

reviews.text: The rooms were just the right size and clean, as were the bathrooms. The location was great. We were able to walk most places within the city limits. The service was great, and friendly. I also felt very secure in the hotel and the area. It was an overall good experience.
reviews.title: Very accomodating

It is excellently located in the heart of Amsterdam and within close walking distance to the major sites. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit. Thank you to everyone at the Nadia Hotel! Mr. L.T. Renton, Washington United States

The hotel also provided a very good location and a great view while we had morning breakfast.

reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.title: Well recommended for a 2-star hotel - can't wait to go back !

reviews.text: Stayed here end of Aug with my 2 teenage daughters. Arrived to very friendly staff and free cans of drink and flowers which was lovely. Stairs unbelievable but never had to carry suitcases up ourselves as a porter did it. The room we booked was a deluxe with full canal view but altho the view was lovely, the room was far too small for the 3 of us with 3 cases. The noisy scaffolders arrived a week early to the Manager's surprise so we were moved to room 310, a lovely large,light 4 bed room (family Room) Will def. book this one in the future! BTW , bring mosquito plug-ins and sprays etc . I was bitten a couple of times. Great view of church and canal and that church is just lovely with beautiful chimes.Tram stop right nearby with a supermarket opposite it. Get your strip of tram tickets at a newsagent as pricey on the trams themselves. (You have an hour to get back on any tram if you want to use the same just-stamped ticket.).The Anne Frank House is round the corner (go late to avoid queues) and there is a great place to eat further down from th Anne Frank house on the same side, called the Pancake Bakery -yummy large pancakes savoury or sweet in an in a characterful old warehouse (see photo!).Good clothes shopping to be done in Kalverstraat & Nieuwendijk, just off the Dam Square and there is a good tattoo artist in Gravenstraat too ;) . If you are a Miffy fan (called 'Nintje' in Holland, and created there) take the no. 5 tram to the Miffy shop (called De Winkel van Nijntje) at Beethovenstraat. Get off at "Gerrit v.d. Veenstraat ". Hope the review was helpful and thanks to the Nadia Staff for making our stay pleasureable.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay

reviews.title: Quaint Hotel

reviews.title: 3rd stay there, basic but has all, central location

The room had everything we needed and the continental breakfast was a bonus. There is a tram stop right there so it was easy to take the tram and train to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Great place, nice and friendly staffs!

If you want massive rooms, can't climb stairs or want a top class brekkie, it isn't for you. I would highly recommend and best price is via the Nadia website. If you want somewhere close to Dam Square, this is the cheapest and best you will find.

The views of canals, trams and bicycle riders (not miserable cyclists like we have in London but people on sensible upright machines with comfortable saddles, who can see where they're going)

The view from the balcony was beautiful even during the month of November, and it was just a 2 or 3 minute walk to Dam Square to see Sinter Klass on his ride around the city center. reviews.text: The Hotel Nadia is in a great location, it is near to most of the touristc places. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the rate and was surprisingly good. The rooms were very small, so small that they ask you to leave some of your luggage in their storage area downstairs. My room was not very clean and the towlels were so old, faded and stained. I really wish I had my own towel with me. Elderly people and young children should not stay in this hotel because there is no elevator and the stairs are extremely dangerous, with very narrow steps, it is very scary. It only makes me wonder how many accidents has happened in those stairs.

reviews.text: I totally disagree with legalyblond901. This is by no means the worst hotel in the world. It was great! Great location and great value. We stayed here for one night on the 21st of June. It was very easy to find after we got on the right tram. After taking the train from the airport to Amsterdam Central Station, we got on tram number 17. The drivers were very friendly (all spoke English) and they let us know what stop to get off. If you do take the number 17, at your stop, you'll see signs for the Ann Frank House. Turn around, the hotel is on the opposite corner on the right-hand side of the street. It's a good hotel with a nice buffet breakfast (typical continental stuff) in the morning. You can walk to the main square in 5 minutes and see all the major sights. I highly recommend the Heineken Experience if you like beer. We would stay here again for sure.

reviews.text: My 19 year old son and I stayed in a comfortable small room for three nights. I had requested a first floor (one flight above street level) and back room because of reports of the steep steps (they are steep, but they help with the bags) and street noise. We found the room quite comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendly and quite helpful in terms of directions and suggestions. There is a tram stop a half block away which is quite convenient in getting to and from the cental station (which is also the way back to the airport). It is centrally located. I think it is competitivelypriced with similar quality establishments in central Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Amsterdam. It certainly helped make our stay in Amsterdam enjoyable.

The room we had was very small, but it did the job, and was spotlessly clean - it had every amenity you needed, fridge, safe, tv etc. The staff are excellent - very friendly, and it's a really welcoming hotel. The very warm and helpful staff at the Nadia made our stay in Amsterdam most enjoyable. There are many stairs to climb at the entrance, but the staff handles all the luggage, and the stairs were really not as bad as they looked. Our room was tiny and simple, but it had everything - TV with lots of channels in English, shower, toilet, even a balcony. Some people might find the tram line noisy, but it didn't bother us. Everything was very clean. The shower/toilet room was also tiny and became very wet and steamy after a shower. We arrived too early for our room and got given a complimentry breakfast whilst we waited. Me and my 4 friends stayed here in January (very cold but still nice!) we booked a quad room on the website and paid on arrival. Room was perfect 4 single beds, we had a tv which played music channels and had a view of the canal. Staff at the hotel were the best I have ever come across, so helpful. They ordered us taxis and ordered us pizzas when we wanted to eat in! They also helped us in with our suitcases up the stairs in the entrance. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in 2006 and were so impressed we booked direct with the hotel to return again this year, Nov 2007. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet area close to Dam Square and Ann Franks house. It is only about 8 mins from Central Station. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are cleaned daily. The rooms are not big but then if like us, you just want a base from which to explore this beautiful city, it is perfect. Our room had a TV, fridge, tea/coffee, shower, wc, safe and comfy bed. What more can you ask for ! The staff are all very friendly and helpful. It was my boyfriend's birthday during our stay and when we got back to the room on the afternoon of his birthday, there was a beautiful bouquet of flowers whishing him a Happy Birthday ! You don't get that sort of customer service very often !! We were really impressed. We checked out on the last day and the hotel kindly stored our luggage until late afternoon. Some guests have commented that the stairs are steep, I think there are about 37 up to main reception, but if you are fit and able, this is not a problem. Lets face it, with all the lovely food you will be eating in Dam, then a bit of exercise is a good thing !! I booked a room with a balcony on this visit and it was so nice to sit outside and watch the world go by in the mornings and the view is beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, here's the deal. After a flight from Moscow, a train ride, a tram ride, a short walk with a ton of luggage, I was pretty upset to see a dingy door leading to two flights of VERY steep and narrow staircase. No elevator. I was not happy (but very polite). Well, there was help. A small man told us we didn't have to worry about bringing our luggage up the stairs and that our luggage would be delivered to our room. OK, I'll buy that. After climbing the stairs we entered a very small and depressing receiving area - the front desk so to speak. Still not happy (and still polite-I do have manners). The man behind the desk took total control of the situation, offered us soda's and told us to wait in the breakfast room while our luggage was being brought up and our room was made ready. We headed down a poorly lit hallway with metal room doors on either side. Still not happy and wondering what we got ourselves into. We took a right and entered the breakfast room. Instant happiness! The room was everything you would want in an old European hotel. The room was small but very well decorated and cozy. There were large and beautiful windows and a door leading to a small balcony. I'm happy now. Anyway, the man told us our room was ready and gave us our key. We walked up two more flights of, again, VERY steep stairs. As we entered our room we were so very happy. It was the top corner room overlooking the canal and church. A door entered onto a small balcony and a set of half-moon windows opened to the canal and church. The room was extremely clean and efficient. High ceilings and everything you could possibly need to make your stay comfortable. The bed was very comfy. In the morning we returned to the breakfast room for the complimentary breakfast. The best croissants, jam, coffee, and juice. Again, very nice. The hotel is located near the Anne Frank house on a canal. I recommend this hotel ONLY if you want to brave the stairs. There is no elevator so you need to be able to climb the stairs. The staff at the hotel is far above average. So - excellent staff, great location, cool room, very clean. Give it a try.
reviews.title: This place grows on you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for two nights, having arranged to layover in Amsterdam on a trip back from Russia. We stayed in a deluxe room with a balcony. It turned out to be a corner room with a great view. It was pretty small, but well-appointed and very nice. Since it was our first trip to Amerstedam, it was a little bit of a challenge figuring out the routine for getting to the hotel via train and tram, but not bad. The 2nd time would be a piece of cake. We ended up getting off the tram too early and dragging our overstuffed luggage a couple of extra blocks to the hotel. We were pretty tired when we arrived at the front entrance. Then -- when the door opened there was an almost vertical narrow staircase descending into the heavens and no lift. We quickly overcame our initial reaction, however. The staff were very friendly and carried all of our bags up to the third floor room. The breakfast was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.
